com.uk.tsl.rfid.asciiprotocol.device

Interface IAsciiTransport


  • public interface IAsciiTransport
    An interface for transports connected to TSL devices using the ASCII 2.0 protocol

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean connect()
      Connect the transport
      ConnectionStatus connectionStatus() 
      void disconnect()
      Disconnect the transport
      java.lang.String getDisplayInfoLine() 
      java.lang.String getDisplayName() 
      java.lang.String id()
      An identifier for the transport - this value tries to correspond to a reader in a way that is consistent across app launches and tries, but is not guaranteed, to be unique.
      Observable<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> linesReceivedEvent()
      Provides an Observable instance that can be monitored for incoming response lines arg1 of the update() method will contain an ArrayList containing the lines
      TransportType type() 
      void writeLine(java.lang.String line)
      Sends the given line over the transport

    • Method Detail

      • type

        TransportType type()
        Returns:
        the TransportType for this instance

      • id

        java.lang.String id()
        An identifier for the transport - this value tries to correspond to a reader in a way that is consistent across app launches and tries, but is not guaranteed, to be unique.
        Returns:
        the id

      • getDisplayName

        java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        Returns:
        the display name for the transport

      • getDisplayInfoLine

        java.lang.String getDisplayInfoLine()
        Returns:
        the info line to display for the transport

      • connect

        boolean connect()
        Connect the transport
        Returns:
        true if the connection attempt started successfully - Observe the connectionStatus() to determine when the device is actually connected

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Disconnect the transport

      • connectionStatus

        ConnectionStatus connectionStatus()
        Returns:
        the ConnectionStatus for this instance

      • linesReceivedEvent

        Observable<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> linesReceivedEvent()
        Provides an Observable instance that can be monitored for incoming response lines arg1 of the update() method will contain an ArrayList containing the lines

      • writeLine

        void writeLine(java.lang.String line)
        Sends the given line over the transport
        Parameters:
        line - the line to be written
